translation:
Friend and Sir Almeida, São Lourenço, April 20, 1845.

That Your Mercy São Gabriel to Cristal, that the liquidation commission ended on May 8, and that all the documents that were legalized would be paid, and for which there was no limited amount; likewise, that such documents to be properly legalized depend on the signature of one of the generals, or the chief.

Therefore, the two I previously sent through Your Mercy Viana, Your Mercy Viana took them; I would have them initialed here by Bento, and would send them by the same person who must depart from there on the 26th of the current month; finally rendering void the two documents that Viana himself already took, when what I have just told you is verified.

Thus, I kindly ask you to tell me something if you know anything about such collection. We commend ourselves to your family; and to Your Mercy

Your friend and obliged servant, Antônio Francisco dos Santos Abreu.

Postscript: Viana took the documents from Your Mercy, one dated March 15, 1835 — Amount of the yacht: 4:000$000. Another dated October 12, 1836 — Same of 5 slaves from the Jaguarão estate: José, field worker — 800$000; Joaquim, likewise — 700$000; Alberto, likewise — 600$000; Pedro, likewise — 700$000; Fermiano — 800$000.

São Lourenço, April 20, 1845. Received on June 24, 1845. Answered on June 27, 1845.
